    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[The long-range drone that can keep up with a car and fly for an hour]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/the-long-range-drone-that-can-keep-up-with-a-car-and-fly-for-an-hour/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[A German team are aiming to build a faster drone that can keep going for longer by adding combustion engines.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/the-long-range-drone-that-can-keep-up-with-a-car-and-fly-for-an-hour/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 27 May 2015 14:31:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Five silver linings of the public cloud]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/five-silver-linings-of-the-public-cloud/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Customers of Amazon Web Services reveal the rewards of migrating key systems to the public cloud platform.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/five-silver-linings-of-the-public-cloud/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Fri, 17 Apr 2015 08:11:58 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Why studying computer science may not be the best choice for infosec professionals]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/why-studying-computer-science-may-not-be-the-best-choice-for-infosec-professionals/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Business and liberal arts majors are starting to win information security jobs away from computer science graduates as the changing nature of the job requires softer skills - according to one of the world's largest trainers of infosec professionals.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/why-studying-computer-science-may-not-be-the-best-choice-for-infosec-professionals/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 16 Apr 2015 00:01:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[How 3D printing could make robotic hands more affordable]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/how-3d-printing-could-make-robotic-hands-more-affordable/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[The start-up that wants to make customised, robotic hands available to the millions of people with missing hands worldwide.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/how-3d-printing-could-make-robotic-hands-more-affordable/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Mon, 30 Mar 2015 11:42:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[How to scale online services for millions of users without losing vital data]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/how-to-scale-online-services-for-millions-of-users-without-losing-vital-data/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[European gambling portal bet365 on how the programming language Erlang and the NoSQL data store Riak is helping it handle millions of transactions at once.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/how-to-scale-online-services-for-millions-of-users-without-losing-vital-data/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 25 Mar 2015 11:07:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Forget the smartphone hype, PCs are still the most important business gadget]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/forget-the-smartphone-hype-pcs-are-still-the-most-important-business-gadget/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Smartphones might create gadget envy, but it seems that nothing beats a PC for real work.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Steve Ranger]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/forget-the-smartphone-hype-pcs-are-still-the-most-important-business-gadget/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 18 Mar 2015 13:01:40 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[The machines that defined British computing: From the Spectrum, BBC Micro and Amstrad to...the Flan]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/the-machines-that-defined-british-computing-from-the-spectrum-bbc-micro-and-amstrad-to-the-flan/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[As the Raspberry Pi edges closer to becoming the best-selling British computer of all time we take a look at the classic machines to come out of the UK.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/the-machines-that-defined-british-computing-from-the-spectrum-bbc-micro-and-amstrad-to-the-flan/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 26 Feb 2015 11:23:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[UK poised to relax rules on employing overseas workers for some IT jobs]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/uk-poised-to-relax-rules-on-employing-overseas-workers-for-some-it-jobs/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[The UK government is recommended to allow start-ups to employ workers from outside Europe in developer and cyber security roles without trying to fill those roles domestically.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/uk-poised-to-relax-rules-on-employing-overseas-workers-for-some-it-jobs/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 25 Feb 2015 15:00:44 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Bigger budgets, better tech: Why 2015 is a good year to be working in IT]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/bigger-budgets-better-tech-why-2015-is-a-good-year-to-be-working-in-it/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[CIOs are feeling optimistic about their prospects and budgets are on the up.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[Steve Ranger]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/bigger-budgets-better-tech-why-2015-is-a-good-year-to-be-working-in-it/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Wed, 04 Feb 2015 13:38:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Raspberry Pi 2 launch: Six times faster with Windows 10 and Ubuntu support]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/raspberry-pi-2-launch-six-times-faster-with-support-for-windows-10-and-ubuntu/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[A major update to the credit card sized Raspberry Pi board is introduced, with a boost to the CPU and memory expected to help it run as a general-purpose PC.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/raspberry-pi-2-launch-six-times-faster-with-support-for-windows-10-and-ubuntu/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Mon, 02 Feb 2015 13:14:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Why your urine could usher in an era of personalised medicine]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/why-your-urine-could-usher-in-an-era-of-personalised-medicine/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[How big data analytics is providing insight into the chemical make-up of our bodies at a unmatched level of detail, and why it could lead to bespoke treatments and diagnoses.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/why-your-urine-could-usher-in-an-era-of-personalised-medicine/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Fri, 30 Jan 2015 12:47:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Time for IT jobs to be set aside for women]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/time-for-quotas-for-women-in-it/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[With women accounting for only a fraction of people studying computer science, there have been calls for gender-related quotas for IT roles.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/time-for-quotas-for-women-in-it/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Mon, 26 Jan 2015 15:09:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Mayor of city that threw out Microsoft told to end attacks on Linux]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/mayor-of-city-that-threw-out-microsoft-told-to-end-attacks-on-linux/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[The mayor of Munich, the city that replaced Windows with Linux, is told his public attacks on the move to open source are hampering efforts to end the authority's IT staffing shortage.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/mayor-of-city-that-threw-out-microsoft-told-to-end-attacks-on-linux/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 10:49:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Businesses not hiring IT apprentices despite skills shortage claims]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/businesses-not-taking-on-it-apprentices-despite-claims-of-skills-shortage/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Despite claims the UK and US are in the grip of an IT skills shortage, the number of people being accepted for IT apprenticeships has fallen by one third - with fewer than one in 10 applicants securing places.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/businesses-not-taking-on-it-apprentices-despite-claims-of-skills-shortage/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Mon, 15 Dec 2014 15:22:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[On-demand 3D printing services take aim at small businesses]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/small-businesses-get-3d-printing-on-demand/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></link>
      <s:doctype><![CDATA[content_article]]></s:doctype>
      <description><![CDATA[Almost half of of consumer, heavy industry and life sciences manufacturers are expected to be using 3D printers within three years. To help companies experiment with the technology on-demand 3D printing services are springing up.]]></description>
      <dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[http://www.techrepublic.com/blog/european-technology/small-businesses-get-3d-printing-on-demand/#ftag=RSS56d97e7]]></guid>
      <pubDate>Tue, 09 Dec 2014 15:51:00 +0000</pubDate>
    </item>
  </channel>
